meanings.definition: To flatten or crush with great force.
meanings.sent1: The heavy book pancaked the delicate flower.
meanings.sent2: The chef pancaked the dough before baking it.
meanings.sent3: The pancaked sandwich looked more like a work of art than a meal.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake pancaked the buildings in the city.
meanings.sent5: The car accident pancaked the vehicles together in a tangled mess.

meanings.definition: To collapse or fall flat like a pancake.
meanings.sent1: The poorly built tower pancaked to the ground.
meanings.sent2: The inflatable pool pancaked after too much weight was put on it.
meanings.sent3: The plan to surprise her with a cake pancaked when she walked in early.
meanings.sent4: The hopes of winning the game pancaked when the star player got injured.
meanings.sent5: The snowman pancaked under the warm sun, melting away slowly.
